definition: riddles written on lanterns (e.g. for the Lantern Festival at the end of Chinese New Year)
lamp/light/lantern/CL:盞|盏[zhan3]
riddle
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
Spring lantern riddles (guessing game at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节, at the end of Spring festival 春節|春节)

sentences.english: Xiao Hong likes guessing riddles written on lanterns most.
Part of the lantern festival tradition involves a game to guess riddles attached to the lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节传统习俗中还有一部分是关于猜灯谜的游戏。

sentences.english: Young singles gathered around for lantern riddle quiz and matchmaking games.
sentences.chinese: 年青的单身人士聚在一起猜灯谜和玩情侣配对游戏。

sentences.english: During the Lantern Festival, people will try to solve the puzzles on the lanterns and eat yuanxiao (glutinous rice ball).
sentences.chinese: 在元宵节期间，人们会试着猜灯谜，吃汤圆。

sentences.english: "Guessing the lantern riddles" began to spread from the ancient characteristics of the activities in the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: “猜灯谜”是从古代就开始流传的元宵节特色活动。

sentences.english: As riddle guessing is interesting and full of wisdom, it has become popular among all social  strata.
sentences.chinese: 猜灯谜活动极富情趣和智慧，因此在全社会广受欢迎。

sentences.english: Young and old compete in lantern contests and 1 competitions.
sentences.chinese: 男女老少进行彩灯比赛和猜灯谜比赛。

sentences.english: The traditional riddles are written on the lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 传统的灯谜是直接写在灯笼上的。

sentences.english: And traditional activities such as guessing lantern riddles will also be held.
sentences.chinese: 此外，园内还举行传统的猜灯谜活动。

sentences.english: The Lantern Riddle is a special word-game played by the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 猜灯谜是中国特有的文字游戏。

sentences.english: Started in the Southern Song Dynasty riddles , lively, interesting sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 始于南宋的灯谜，生动活泼，饶有风趣。

sentences.english: On the Lantern Festival, many people will carry colorful lanterns and attend the riddle-guessing contests.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节时，很多人会提灯笼，去参加猜灯谜大会。

sentences.english: Riddles are written on lanterns for people to guess.
sentences.chinese: 单身人士会聚集在灯会猜猜灯谜，找个合眼缘的人。

sentences.english: They go there to see giant lanterns and play quizzes.
sentences.chinese: 他们去那里看大型花灯还有猜灯谜。

sentences.english: Do you know any good riddles for the lanterns?
sentences.chinese: 你知道有哪些元宵好灯谜吗？

definition: riddle/conundrum/CL:條|条[tiao2]
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
letter puzzle
Spring Festival couplet (the first line of which is pasted on the right side of a doorway at New Year, and the second on the left side)
rhyming couplet/pair of lines of verse written vertically down the sides of a doorway/CL:副[fu4],幅[fu2]
couplet (hung on the columns of a hall)
folk musical theater
verse
dragon dance
Chinese opera
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
wine-drinking game
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
to adorn/to festoon
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Spring lantern riddles (guessing game at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节, at the end of Spring festival 春節|春节)
